featuring.name: Mark Godoy, Jr.
featuring.bio: Mark is a visual artist, motion designer, and advocate for victims of childhood sexual abuse. Through his story and his art, he strives to inspire survivors around the world to embrace healing and break free from the negative stigma surrounding sexual abuse.

featuring.name: Ted Gonzaga
featuring.bio: Ted grew up and achieved his childhood dream of being an airline pilot and volunteers in various non-profit organizations in his free time. Ted is a survivor of sexual assault/abuse from within his family. He shares his story to hopefully show fellow survivors you are not alone and can be okay.

featuring.name: Adam Hawkins
featuring.bio: Adam, a survivor of an abusive childhood, embarked on a transformative journey of healing and spirituality during a walkabout across Europe and Asia. Now a passionate advocate, he dedicates his efforts to championing causes such as HIV/AIDS, substance use disorder, LGBTQ+ rights, and homelessness in his current home of Atlanta, Georgia.

featuring.name: Ben Holman
featuring.bio: Ben Holman is an investigator for cps, a member of the RAINN Speakers Bureau, and a survivor of sexual abuse. He hopes to use his story to help other men find hope and victory over their own stories.

featuring.name: Jordan Masciangelo
featuring.bio: By focusing on healing and community, Jordan has spent the past 12 years successfully transforming his own experiences of sexual violence and trafficking into powerful inspiration and advocacy for other male survivors as well as trauma-informed speaking engagements, training, and consulting services.

featuring.name: Anthony Rivers
featuring.bio: Through support and resilience, Anthony has overcome numerous life challenges and now uses his experiences to inspire others as a public speaker, inclusion consultant, and mental health advocate.

featuring.name: Shawn Wildermuth
featuring.bio: Shawn is a filmmaker who makes very personal documentaries. He knew that he wanted to tell the story of his shared experience of childhood sexual abuse. `Man Enough to Heal` is the culmination of that goal.

featuring.name: Thom Young
featuring.bio: Thom retired from a long career in long enforcement and a second career as an airline pilot. He now enjoys volunteering at various non-profit organizations and his church in retirement. Thom is a also survivor or sexual assault. He hopes sharing his story will offer help and hope to other victims of abuse.

also.name: Howard Fradkin, Ph.D.
also.bio: Howard has LICDC has counseled over 1000 male survivors in individual, couples, group psychotherapy and weekend workshops over the course of his 39-year career as a Psychologist.
also.title: Facilitator Emeritus, MenHealing.org

also.name: Mike Lew, M.Ed.
also.bio: Mike is director of The Next Step Counseling and Training Centre. Mike Lew has worked with thousands of men and women in their healing from the effects of sexual child abuse, rape, physical violence, emotional abuse and neglect.
also.title: The Next Step Counseling and Training

partners.name: MaleSurvivor
partners.blurb: MaleSurvivor provides a community for survivors including a really useful forum to discuss a variety of subjects important to men recovering from childhood sexual abuse.

partners.name: moMENtum
partners.blurb: Momentum is a peer support group for adult male survivors of childhood sexual abuse.

screenings.name: One Night Only in Boston (Cambridge), MA
screenings.description: We're having a one-night-only screening of the film.

screenings.name: Peachtree Village International Film Festival
screenings.description: Selected as a feature-length documentary film for their program.

screenings.name: AltFF Alternative Film Festival
screenings.description: Nominated for Best Documentary Feature at AtlFF Fall 2023

screenings.name: Freedom Festival International Film Festival
screenings.description: Selected as a feature-length documentary film
